HERP.content: why striking (marquant)? because prägen (mark, strike, leave imprint) is found so frequently in Heidegger > philosophy forged, stamped (geprägt) by Heraclitus in name of gathering, gathered originarily in one striking force, one trait > Kampf
HERP.linkedContent: why striking (marquant)? because prägen (mark, strike, leave imprint) is found so frequently in Heidegger > philosophy forged, stamped (geprägt) by Heraclitus in name of gathering, gathered originarily in one striking force, one trait > Kampf

PP.content: pharmakon means coup, stroke of fate (un coup du sort), dice-throw (le coup de théâtre), le coup double, un coup pour rien, un coup tiré, un coup de force, un coup monté
PP.linkedContent: pharmakon means coup, stroke of fate (un coup du sort), dice-throw (le coup de théâtre), le coup double, un coup pour rien, un coup tiré, un coup de force, un coup monté

PAS.content: an infinite patience that crosses the limit in one stroke, a forgetting that overflows all philosophical and psychoanalytic determinations w/out omitting their pertinence
PAS.linkedContent: an infinite patience that crosses the limit in one stroke, a forgetting that overflows all philosophical and psychoanalytic determinations w/out omitting their pertinence

S.content: acc. Heidegger, first blow is simple duality if difference (Zweifache), second blow is agonistic dissension (Zweitracht) [see p. 106]
S.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, first blow is simple duality if difference (Zweifache), second blow is agonistic dissension (Zweitracht) [see p. 106]

S.content: double mark, doubly remarkable trait [engraves sadness in spirit’s relation to itself, affinity w/ Schlag]: it is the spirit in which it inscribes itself, traces itself, belongs to flame it divides
S.linkedContent: double mark, doubly remarkable trait [engraves sadness in spirit’s relation to itself, affinity w/ Schlag]: it is the spirit in which it inscribes itself, traces itself, belongs to flame it divides

S.content: Heidegger’s resurrection to come of Menschenschlag [a third blow?], blow which saves (rettet), hymn to archi-originary, yet-to-come event, what poet sings
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s resurrection to come of Menschenschlag [a third blow?], blow which saves (rettet), hymn to archi-originary, yet-to-come event, what poet sings

T.content: philosophy has always thought its other, that which limits it; does to think the other solely mean relever, to control the other? or does the limit/passage always reserve one more coup; to think the proper of the other, the other as such is to miss it, to miss the missing of the other [on manque (de) le manquer]: examine the relevance of the limit
T.linkedContent: philosophy has always thought its other, that which limits it; does to think the other solely mean relever, to control the other? or does the limit/passage always reserve one more coup; to think the proper of the other, the other as such is to miss it, to miss the missing of the other [on manque (de) le manquer]: examine the relevance of the limit

T.content: after every perforation, one [philosophy] is dying to replace w/ a glorious cadaver, ce temps timbré entre l’écriture et la parole (s’) appellent un coup de donc [GLAS]: it suffices, barely, to wait!
T.linkedContent: after every perforation, one [philosophy] is dying to replace w/ a glorious cadaver, ce temps timbré entre l’écriture et la parole (s’) appellent un coup de donc [GLAS]: it suffices, barely, to wait!

DS.content: “the masculine is turned back on the feminine: whole adventure of sexual difference” > in same blow: fold ruptures virginity it marks as virginity, folding over its secret > nothing more virginal (and at same time) more purloined/penetrated than secret (loses smooth simplicity of its surface)
DS.linkedContent: “the masculine is turned back on the feminine: whole adventure of sexual difference” > in same blow: fold ruptures virginity it marks as virginity, folding over its secret > nothing more virginal (and at same time) more purloined/penetrated than secret (loses smooth simplicity of its surface)

DS.content: secret differs before letter opener separates lips of the book, divided from/by itself, like hymen > after the fact, it remains what it was, virgin
DS.linkedContent: secret differs before letter opener separates lips of the book, divided from/by itself, like hymen > after the fact, it remains what it was, virgin

SP.content: fine point (of spur) cannot be honed (effiler) in single stroke (coup)
SP.linkedContent: fine point (of spur) cannot be honed (effiler) in single stroke (coup)

SP.content: “the exchange of stylistic blows (coup) or the thrust (coup) of a dagger confuses sexual identity”
SP.linkedContent: “the exchange of stylistic blows (coup) or the thrust (coup) of a dagger confuses sexual identity”

O.content: “la dissémination (se) produit (dans) cela : coupe de plaisir” > il rythme et le plaisir et la répétition selon une coupe multiple > il [text, literature, the beyond of the whole] imprime pourtant au tout, depuis le “dedans” du système où il marque ses effets de colonne vide et inscrite, un mouvement de fiction ——coupe claire, coupe définitive, coupe à tire et à aire [different ways to clear out trees]
O.linkedContent: “la dissémination (se) produit (dans) cela : coupe de plaisir” > il rythme et le plaisir et la répétition selon une coupe multiple > il [text, literature, the beyond of the whole] imprime pourtant au tout, depuis le “dedans” du système où il marque ses effets de colonne vide et inscrite, un mouvement de fiction ——coupe claire, coupe définitive, coupe à tire et à aire [different ways to clear out trees]

O.content: preface—external seal, final kick (coup final), kick-off (coup d’envoi)
O.linkedContent: preface—external seal, final kick (coup final), kick-off (coup d’envoi)

O.content: mise en jeu sans prélude, de ce qui reste à préparer d’un coup [no prelude for all the coups]
O.linkedContent: mise en jeu sans prélude, de ce qui reste à préparer d’un coup [no prelude for all the coups]

O.content: if you wanna see for yourself, encounter by chance, enmeshed (engrenés) in some corner (coin), ce qui’l en est de la coupe or/livre
O.linkedContent: if you wanna see for yourself, encounter by chance, enmeshed (engrenés) in some corner (coin), ce qui’l en est de la coupe or/livre

DPi.content: vertigos, head spinning, head falling (one blow of guillotine), turn around neck of decollation [cf. GLAS, O], everything turns around what turns (not merely rhetorical turns), turns of phrase given to expression “condemned to death” or “condemned to die”: revolution, conversion, faith and DP, DP and belief > highs & lows we climb up/down to point of vertigo
DPi.linkedContent: vertigos, head spinning, head falling (one blow of guillotine), turn around neck of decollation [cf. GLAS, O], everything turns around what turns (not merely rhetorical turns), turns of phrase given to expression “condemned to death” or “condemned to die”: revolution, conversion, faith and DP, DP and belief > highs & lows we climb up/down to point of vertigo

Gii.content: Schlag (blow, also race/species in figurative sense) & Geschlecht > Heidegger: our language calls the humanity that has received imprint of striking, or cast in this striking (Schlag), Geschlecht ——das Zwiefache, double, dual duplicitous fold of sexual difference
Gii.linkedContent: Schlag (blow, also race/species in figurative sense) & Geschlecht > Heidegger: our language calls the humanity that has received imprint of striking, or cast in this striking (Schlag), Geschlecht ——das Zwiefache, double, dual duplicitous fold of sexual difference

Gii.content: die Zwietracht der Geschlechter, duality of sexes as dissension, war, disagreement
Gii.linkedContent: die Zwietracht der Geschlechter, duality of sexes as dissension, war, disagreement

Gii.content: what happens when same word, Schlag, is translated 2 different ways: coup, frappe? erases what authorizes Heidegger to find affinity btwn Schlag and Geschlecht
Gii.linkedContent: what happens when same word, Schlag, is translated 2 different ways: coup, frappe? erases what authorizes Heidegger to find affinity btwn Schlag and Geschlecht

Gii.content: [meanings of Geschlecht and Schlag (i.e. imprint of a coin)]
Gii.linkedContent: [meanings of Geschlecht and Schlag (i.e. imprint of a coin)]

Gii.content: savage second blow of sexual difference, its Verwesung, vs. originary, tender sexual difference > Heidegger claims this schema is not Christian/Platonic, but it has no other content and even no other language than Platonism/Christianity > its archi-matinal origin, ultra-Western horizon, constituted by hollow of a repetition, same for Verfall, Ruf, Sorge in structure of Dasein
Gii.linkedContent: savage second blow of sexual difference, its Verwesung, vs. originary, tender sexual difference > Heidegger claims this schema is not Christian/Platonic, but it has no other content and even no other language than Platonism/Christianity > its archi-matinal origin, ultra-Western horizon, constituted by hollow of a repetition, same for Verfall, Ruf, Sorge in structure of Dasein

PIO.content: double blow of “Fable” is its invention > gives itself, by itself, a patent of invention
PIO.linkedContent: double blow of “Fable” is its invention > gives itself, by itself, a patent of invention

PIO.content: double blow, the same blow: fabulous invention becomes invention of truth
PIO.linkedContent: double blow, the same blow: fabulous invention becomes invention of truth

AFR.content: philosophy is historical for Condillac: it always comes after cognition, after a scientific discovery; his philosophical method can only be established après coup—or stroke (coup) of genius
AFR.linkedContent: philosophy is historical for Condillac: it always comes after cognition, after a scientific discovery; his philosophical method can only be established après coup—or stroke (coup) of genius

AFR.content: to introduce (not saturate, not intrude [s’introduire]): seduce the text (not the reader), surprise it close to its content > a rigorous “abyss”
AFR.linkedContent: to introduce (not saturate, not intrude [s’introduire]): seduce the text (not the reader), surprise it close to its content > a rigorous “abyss”

AFR.content: follow lines, grafts, borders, ribs: analyze its machine of oppositions, its program, and what breaches the program, defeats its teleology, undecides its circle: suspend text on one of its nervures après-coupées (cut-after-the-fact-ribs)
AFR.linkedContent: follow lines, grafts, borders, ribs: analyze its machine of oppositions, its program, and what breaches the program, defeats its teleology, undecides its circle: suspend text on one of its nervures après-coupées (cut-after-the-fact-ribs)

D.content: in Soller’s Numbers, cette fois enfin, “cette fois enfin” not an accomplishment w/ single blow of the pen or the die (d’écriture ou de dés): nothing could be more foreign to eschatology (of or by way of literature) than Soller’s finite-infinite seriation (enchaînement) of numbers
D.linkedContent: in Soller’s Numbers, cette fois enfin, “cette fois enfin” not an accomplishment w/ single blow of the pen or the die (d’écriture ou de dés): nothing could be more foreign to eschatology (of or by way of literature) than Soller’s finite-infinite seriation (enchaînement) of numbers

D.content: “primitive” mythical unity always reconstituted retrospectively dans l’après-coupure > the decision, le coup (shot, throw, blow) parts the seed as it projects it (partage la semence en la projetant)
D.linkedContent: “primitive” mythical unity always reconstituted retrospectively dans l’après-coupure > the decision, le coup (shot, throw, blow) parts the seed as it projects it (partage la semence en la projetant)

EL.content: Geschlecht and Schlag (stamp, imprint) > “we” that undergoes relation to itself out of (depuis) menacing interpellation of Geschlecht by apocalyptic speech (parole)
EL.linkedContent: Geschlecht and Schlag (stamp, imprint) > “we” that undergoes relation to itself out of (depuis) menacing interpellation of Geschlecht by apocalyptic speech (parole)

C.content: get down to it (s’y mettre), commit oneself, donner du gage (give proof, evidence, wager) > get in the coffin, spread out: à chaque coup for the first and last time, always the first and last
C.linkedContent: get down to it (s’y mettre), commit oneself, donner du gage (give proof, evidence, wager) > get in the coffin, spread out: à chaque coup for the first and last time, always the first and last

SPEC.content: an abyss of more than one generation [Freud & Ernst] (also said about computers), an a priori of an aftereffect (d’un après-coup) [Derrida doing this too?] > formal structure se donne à lire once objects can substitute for each other (laying bare substitutive structure itself)
SPEC.linkedContent: an abyss of more than one generation [Freud & Ernst] (also said about computers), an a priori of an aftereffect (d’un après-coup) [Derrida doing this too?] > formal structure se donne à lire once objects can substitute for each other (laying bare substitutive structure itself)
